an3.13:4.1: “These three people are found in the world.
an3.13:4.3: The hopeless, the hopeful, and the one who has done away with hope.
an3.13:4.4: And what, mendicants, is a hopeless person?
an3.13:4.5: It’s when some person is reborn in a low family—a family of outcastes, bamboo-workers, hunters, chariot-makers, or waste-collectors—poor, with little to eat or drink, where life is tough, and food and shelter are hard to find.
an3.13:4.6: And they’re ugly, unsightly, deformed, chronically ill—one-eyed, crippled, lame, or half-paralyzed. They don’t get to have food, drink, clothes, and vehicles; garlands, perfumes, and makeup; or bed, house, and lighting.
an3.13:4.8: ‘They say the aristocrats have anointed the aristocrat named so-and-so as king.’
an3.13:4.10: ‘Oh, when will the aristocrats anoint me too as king?’
an3.13:4.11: This is called a hopeless person.
an3.13:5.1: And what, mendicants, is a hopeful person?
an3.13:5.2: It’s when some person is the eldest son of an anointed king. He has not yet been anointed, but is eligible, and has been confirmed in the succession.
an3.13:5.4: ‘They say that the aristocrats have anointed the aristocrat named so-and-so as king.’
an3.13:5.6: ‘Oh, when will the aristocrats anoint me too as king?’
an3.13:5.7: This is called a hopeful person.
an3.13:6.1: And what, mendicants, is a person who has done away with hope?
an3.13:6.2: It’s when a king has been anointed.
an3.13:6.4: ‘They say that the aristocrats have anointed the aristocrat named so-and-so as king.’
an3.13:6.6: ‘Oh, when will the aristocrats anoint me too as king?’
an3.13:6.8: Because the former hope he had to be anointed has now died down.
an3.13:6.9: This is called a person who has done away with hope.
an3.13:6.10: These are the three people found in the world.
an3.13:7.1: So too, these three people are found among the mendicants.
an3.13:7.3: The hopeless, the hopeful, and the one who has done away with hope.
an3.13:7.4: And what, mendicants, is a hopeless person?
an3.13:7.5: It’s when some person is unethical, of bad qualities, filthy, with suspicious behavior, secretive, no true ascetic or spiritual practitioner—though claiming to be one—rotten inside, corrupt, and depraved.
an3.13:7.7: ‘They say that the mendicant named so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having achieved it with their own insight due to the end of defilements.’
an3.13:7.9: ‘Oh, when will I too realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having achieved it with my own insight due to the end of defilements.’
an3.13:7.10: This is called a hopeless person.
an3.13:8.1: And what, mendicants, is a hopeful person?
an3.13:8.2: It’s when a mendicant is ethical, of good character.
an3.13:8.4: ‘They say that the mendicant named so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having achieved it with their own insight due to the end of defilements.’
an3.13:8.6: ‘Oh, when will I too realize the supreme culmination of the spiritual path in this very life, and live having achieved with my own insight the goal for which people from good families rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.’
an3.13:8.7: This is called a hopeful person.
an3.13:9.1: And what, mendicants, is a person who has done away with hope?
an3.13:9.2: It’s when a mendicant is a perfected one, who has ended all defilements.
an3.13:9.4: ‘They say that the mendicant named so-and-so has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having achieved it with their own insight due to the end of defilements.’
an3.13:9.6: ‘Oh, when will I too realize the supreme culmination of the spiritual path in this very life, and live having achieved with my own insight the goal for which people from good families rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.’
an3.13:9.8: Because the former hope he had to be freed has now died down.
an3.13:9.9: This is called a person who has done away with hope.
an3.13:9.10: These are the three people found among the mendicants.”
